column1: Two groups of Taiwanese nationals have returned home after being stranded by the coronavirus pandemic in 2 countries. The CECC says some 30 nationals returned from India while 11 Taiwanese came from Saudi Arabia. All will be quarantined and checked for COVID-19 symptoms.

Two groups of #Taiwanese have finally returned home after being stranded by the #coronavirus #pandemic. About 30 people arrived last night via a #SouthKorean flight from #India and #Maldives, while 11 more from #SaudiArabia were brought back through cooperation with #Japan.

The Tourism Bureau says the suspension of tours to China imposed on local travel agencies will be extended until the end of February amid an increase in the number of 2019 coronavirus cases.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is expressing its gratitude for the support of the Japanese and Canadian governments in calling for Taiwan's participation in the World Health Organization in light of the new coronavirus outbreak.
Vice President Chen Chien-jen says for the average person, wearing a surgical face mask is not entirely necessary to prevent contracting the 2019 novel coronavirus.
President Tsai Ing-wen says some 4.2-million surgical masks per day will be released to the public from today in order to meet widespread demand due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Health Minister Chen Shih-chung says authorities have confirmed Taiwan's second domestic case of the 2019 novel coronavirus.

France now has 57 #COVID19 cases, a sharp increase from just a few days ago when the country announced that all existing cases have been discharged.
Japan now has 233 #COVID19 cases and 11 deaths. The Diamond Princess cruise ship docking over Yokohama has 705 cases in total.
Italy now has 888 #COVID19 cases, 21 deaths and 46 patients have been discharged. A professional football player has been tested positive for the virus.

More on #COVID19 - American airline United announced that they will reduce flights to Asian countries starting March, in light of #COVID19 outbreak in several countries. Flights to Tokyo, Osaka and Singapore will be reduced and flights to Seoul will be operated by smaller planes.
